laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal hematocrit (39.9%), white cells (7,100/mm³), neutrophils (59%), and platelets (229,000/mm³). Hemoglobin was 10.7 g/dl.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Hematocrit decreased from 39.9% to 33.1% and 33.3% leading up to admission.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Initially revealed turbid urine with 6 to 8 white cells per high-power field.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up urinalysis showed 2 to 4 white cells per high-power field.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Electrolyte levels and liver-function tests were normal.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Serologic Tests for Leptospira, Salmonella typhi, Toxoplasma, HIV, Hepatitis B, and Hepatitis C

laboratory_examinations.findings: Showed chronic lymphocytic inflammation with no granulomas. Warthin–Starry stain revealed extracellular bacilli.
IgG titers to B. henselae and B. quintana exceeded 1:1024; IgM titers for both were less than 1:20.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up two months later showed continued IgG positivity and a B. henselae IgM titer of 1:80.
